clusters.title: 8 skiers dead after avalanche near California's Lake Tahoe; 9th still missing
clusters.neutral_headline: Eight skiers found dead after California avalanche
bullet_summary: The avalanche was reported near Castle Peak in Nevada County, north of Boreal Mountain Ski Resort
Authorities say the bodies of eight backcountry skiers have been found and one remains missing after an avalanche near Lake Tahoe in California
Six others were found alive
Eight skiers have been found dead, and one is still missing, after an avalanche in the northern California mountains, authorities have said

items.title: California avalanche near Lake Tahoe is among the deadliest in U.S. history
items.standfirst: An avalanche near California's Lake Tahoe​ has become the fourth deadliest in U.S. history. Here's what we know about the six deadliest slides.
items.content: An avalanche near California's Lake Tahoe​ has become the fourth deadliest in U.S. history. Here's what we know about the six deadliest slides.

items.title: Eight skiers found dead after California avalanche
items.standfirst: Fifteen skiers went missing on Tuesday following a massive avalanche in California's Lake Tahoe region. One person remains missing but is presumed dead.
items.content: Fifteen skiers went missing on Tuesday following a massive avalanche in California's Lake Tahoe region. One person remains missing but is presumed dead.

items.title: 8 backcountry skiers found dead and 1 still missing after California avalanche
items.standfirst: Authorities say the bodies of eight backcountry skiers have been found and one remains missing after an avalanche near Lake Tahoe in California. Six others were found alive.
items.content: Authorities say the bodies of eight backcountry skiers have been found and one remains missing after an avalanche near Lake Tahoe in California. Six others were found alive.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Law enforcement says eight killed by avalanche in California mountains

items.content: One person remains missing after a heavy avalanche engulfed a group of skiers in the US's Sierra Nevada mountains.

items.title: Eight of nine missing skiers found dead in California avalanche
items.standfirst: Eight skiers have died after an avalanche tore through the slopes of California's Sierra Nevada mountains, authorities said Wednesday, as rescuers continued searching for one other missing person from the group.
items.content: Eight skiers have died after an avalanche tore through the slopes of California's Sierra Nevada mountains, authorities said Wednesday, as rescuers continued searching for one other missing person from the group.

items.title: Eight skiers found dead after avalanche in California amid 'horrific conditions'

items.content: Eight skiers have been found dead, and one is still missing, after an avalanche in the northern California mountains, authorities have said.

Zuckerberg said Meta has introduced some “proactive tools” to try to identify and remove accounts used by children under 13, but called it a “challenging” problem

items.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
items.standfirst: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.
items.content: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg Tries to Play It Safe in Social Media Addiction Trial Testimony
items.standfirst: The Meta CEO stuck to a playbook of repetitive answers and buzzwords in a landmark trial in Los Angeles on Wednesday.
items.content: The Meta CEO stuck to a playbook of repetitive answers and buzzwords in a landmark trial in Los Angeles on Wednesday.

items.title: Zuckerberg questioned on under-13 Instagram users in social media trial
items.standfirst: The Meta CEO defended his company's efforts to keep kids under 13 off of Instagram, but noted that there are "people who lie" about their ages.
items.content: The Meta CEO defended his company's efforts to keep kids under 13 off of Instagram, but noted that there are "people who lie" about their ages.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg faces intense questioning in social media addiction trial
items.standfirst: Mark Zuckerberg took the stand on Wednesday to fight off allegations that Instagram was intentionally designed to be addictive, especially to kids. Jo Ling Kent was in the courtroom and has more on the landmark trial.
items.content: Mark Zuckerberg took the stand on Wednesday to fight off allegations that Instagram was intentionally designed to be addictive, especially to kids. Jo Ling Kent was in the courtroom and has more on the landmark trial.

items.title: Zuckerberg grilled about Meta's strategy to target 'teens' and 'tweens'
items.standfirst: The billionaire tech mogul's testimony was part of a landmark social media addiction trial in Los Angeles. The jury's verdict in the case could shape how some 1,600 other pending cases from families and school districts are resolved.
items.content: The billionaire tech mogul's testimony was part of a landmark social media addiction trial in Los Angeles. The jury's verdict in the case could shape how some 1,600 other pending cases from families and school districts are resolved.(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)

items.title: Zuckerberg Says ‘Difficult’ to Enforce Instagram Age Limits
items.standfirst: Mark Zuckerberg testified that it’s “very difficult” to enforce Instagram’s age limits as he sought to defend the platform during a landmark trial over social media addiction. The chief executive officer of Meta Platforms was sharply questioned on the witness stand Wednesday about the company’s efforts to attract and engage teenage users, and whether it adequately policed accounts belonging to children under 13, despite rules barring them from using the app. Zuckerberg said Meta has introduced some “proactive tools” to try to identify and remove accounts used by children under 13, but called it a “challenging” problem. Bloomberg News Senior Technology Reporter Kurt Wagner joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Mark Zuckerberg testified that it’s “very difficult” to enforce Instagram’s age limits as he sought to defend the platform during a landmark trial over social media addiction. The chief executive officer of Meta Platforms was sharply questioned on the witness stand Wednesday about the company’s efforts to attract and engage teenage users, and whether it adequately policed accounts belonging to children under 13, despite rules barring them from using the app. Zuckerberg said Meta has introduced some “proactive tools” to try to identify and remove accounts used by children under 13, but called it a “challenging” problem. Bloomberg News Senior Technology Reporter Kurt Wagner joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Meta’s Zuckerberg pushes back on social media youth addiction claims
items.standfirst: In a Los Angeles court, the Meta CEO was questioned about whether Instagram’s design contributed to addictive behavior.
items.content: In a Los Angeles court, the Meta CEO was questioned about whether Instagram’s design contributed to addictive behavior.

items.title: Zuckerberg Says ‘Difficult’ to Enforce Instagram Age Limits
items.standfirst: Mark Zuckerberg testified that it’s “very difficult” to enforce Instagram’s age limits and downplayed how much teen users do for the company’s business during a landmark trial over social media addiction.
items.content: Mark Zuckerberg testified that it’s “very difficult” to enforce Instagram’s age limits and downplayed how much teen users do for the company’s business during a landmark trial over social media addiction.

bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, BBC World, France24

items.title: Former South Korean president faces insurrection verdict over martial law order
items.standfirst: Impeached former President Yoon Suk Yeol could face the death penalty if he is convicted Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on South Korea
items.content: Impeached former President Yoon Suk Yeol could face the death penalty if he is convicted Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on South Korea

items.title: Martial law, protests and a president tried for insurrection: How did South Korea get here?
items.standfirst: A court is due to deliver its verdict in the insurrection trial of Yoon Suk Yeol.
items.content: A court is due to deliver its verdict in the insurrection trial of Yoon Suk Yeol.

items.title: Court to deliver verdict in ousted South Korean president Yoon’s insurrection trial
items.standfirst: South Korea's disgraced former president Yoon Suk Yeol could be banished to death row on February 19 when he fronts court over his disastrous bid to impose martial law. Seoul's Central District Court will rule on insurrection charges against the 65-year-old, delivering a verdict that will be broadcast live across the nation. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Youngmi Kim, Senior Lecturer at the department of Asian Studies at the University of Edinburgh.
items.content: South Korea's disgraced former president Yoon Suk Yeol could be banished to death row on February 19 when he fronts court over his disastrous bid to impose martial law. Seoul's Central District Court will rule on insurrection charges against the 65-year-old, delivering a verdict that will be broadcast live across the nation. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Youngmi Kim, Senior Lecturer at the department of Asian Studies at the University of Edinburgh.

items.title: Ukraine's officials to boycott Paralympics over Russian flag decision
items.standfirst: Ukrainian officials will boycott the Paralympic Winter Games, Kyiv said on Wednesday, after the International Paralympic Committee allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flag. The EU's sports commissioner Glenn Micallef said he would also skip the opening ceremony. FRANCE 24's Camille Corcoran reports.
items.content: Ukrainian officials will boycott the Paralympic Winter Games, Kyiv said on Wednesday, after the International Paralympic Committee allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flag. The EU's sports commissioner Glenn Micallef said he would also skip the opening ceremony. FRANCE 24's Camille Corcoran reports.

items.content: After crew on flight 543 reported smoke in the cockpit, passengers and crew exited Airbus A320 via slidesTraffic was temporarily disrupted at Newark Liberty international airport in New Jersey on Wednesday after a Florida-bound JetBlue flight suffered an engine failure on takeoff and returned to the airport, officials said.Crew on flight 543 reported smoke in the cockpit, and after an emergency landing, passengers and crew exited the Airbus A320 on a taxiway via slides, the Federal Aviation Administration said. items.standfirst: What’s on the agenda of the inaugural meeting?
items.content: What’s on the agenda of the inaugural meeting?

items.title: 'A very MAGA agenda': Is Trump’s Board of Peace meant to replace the United Nations?
items.standfirst: On the eve of the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump’s "Board of Peace" initiative in Washington, FRANCE 24 spoke to historian and UN expert Alanna O’Malley about how the body reflects the MAGA movement's agenda seeking to further institutionalise US power at a global scale.
items.content: On the eve of the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump’s "Board of Peace" initiative in Washington, FRANCE 24 spoke to historian and UN expert Alanna O’Malley about how the body reflects the MAGA movement's agenda seeking to further institutionalise US power at a global scale.

clusters.title: Pressure mounts on France's far-left party after killing of far-right activist
clusters.neutral_headline: Wave of arrests over killing of French nationalist piles pressure on far left
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World

items.title: Pressure mounts on France's far-left party after killing of far-right activist
items.standfirst: Pressure is mounting on France's far left political party France Unbowed, in the wake of the brutal killing of a far right student activist last week. 11 people have been arrested in connection with the 23-year-old's death, including two parliamentary assistants of a France Unbowed MP. This Wednesday, It comes one month before municipal elections and as the left seeks to position itself ahead of next year's presidential vote. FRANCE 24's Carys Garland explains.
items.content: Pressure is mounting on France's far left political party France Unbowed, in the wake of the brutal killing of a far right student activist last week. 11 people have been arrested in connection with the 23-year-old's death, including two parliamentary assistants of a France Unbowed MP. This Wednesday, It comes one month before municipal elections and as the left seeks to position itself ahead of next year's presidential vote. FRANCE 24's Carys Garland explains.

items.title: France: Parliamentary aide arrested after death of far-right activist
items.standfirst: French police investigating the beating of a far-right militant who died of brain injuries have arrested 11 people, prosecutors said, in a case adding fuel to long-standing divides in French politics ahead of mayoral elections. The 11 people in police custody include the parliamentary aide of far-left France Unbowed MP Raphaël Arnault.
items.content: French police investigating the beating of a far-right militant who died of brain injuries have arrested 11 people, prosecutors said, in a case adding fuel to long-standing divides in French politics ahead of mayoral elections. The 11 people in police custody include the parliamentary aide of far-left France Unbowed MP Raphaël Arnault.

items.title: Wave of arrests over killing of French nationalist piles pressure on far left
items.standfirst: Eleven people are in detention in connection with the killing of far-right student activist Quentin Deranque.
items.content: Eleven people are in detention in connection with the killing of far-right student activist Quentin Deranque.

clusters.title: Peru's Congress ousts president after four months in office
clusters.neutral_headline: Peru's Congress ousts president after four months in office
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, Guardian World

items.title: Peru's Congress ousts president after four months in office
items.standfirst: José Jerí is the third consecutive president to be removed and the country's seventh since 2016.
items.content: José Jerí is the third consecutive president to be removed and the country's seventh since 2016.

items.title: Peru’s president ousted in ‘express impeachment’ after just four months
items.standfirst: Interim president José Jerí voted out by country’s congress amid scandal concerning secretive meetings Peru’s interim president has been forced out of office in an “express impeachment” after a political scandal over his secretive meetings with Chinese businessmen.Lawmakers voted by 75 votes to 24 to proceed with the removal of José Jerí, who had been at the helm for just four months. Continue reading...
items.content: Interim president José Jerí voted out by country’s congress amid scandal concerning secretive meetings Peru’s interim president has been forced out of office in an “express impeachment” after a political scandal over his secretive meetings with Chinese businessmen.Lawmakers voted by 75 votes to 24 to proceed with the removal of José Jerí, who had been at the helm for just four months. Continue reading...
